metadata.titel_preek: Being on the Gigantic Stage with Jesus

kernfrasen: gigantic stage on which are played a thousand dramas daily
room on that stage for all of us
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: LIFE WITH JESUS IS A THEATRICAL PERFORMANCE

kernfrasen: transformative action that will change his life circumstance
not being an orphan in the world

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: We, with our baptism, have agreed to perform in the drama of Jesus on his gigantic stage.

brondomein.belichaamde_basis: container/verticality (the stage as a defined space of visibility)

cognitieve_implicaties: Life is not random; it has a narrative structure and a director.
theologische_implicaties: Discipleship is an active, visible participation in God's unfolding story.
ethische_implicaties: One must choose their 'role' carefully (healer vs. silencer).
onbedoelde_consequenties: Faith might be seen as 'performative' or inauthentic (just acting).

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'Grand Central Station' radio trope to frame the entire Gospel narrative as a dynamic, public event.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the 'Stage' metaphor as a master-frame that successfully contains the medical, relational, and journey metaphors without conflict.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The stage is the 'where', the family is the 'who', and the path is the 'how' of the drama.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the conventional 'following Jesus' and turns it into a high-stakes dramatic performance.
sterktes.voorbeeld: We get to choose which part we will play.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'stage' metaphor might suggest that suffering (blindness/poverty) is merely a plot device for a show.
risicos.voorbeeld: Jesusâ€™ life... was indeed a gigantic stage for many dramatic performances.
risicos.potentiele_impact: May trivialize the real-world pain of the marginalized.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A 1940s radio-drama atmosphere (Grand Central Station) transitioning into the dusty roads of Jericho.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Using Psalm 34 to show God satisfying all needs.

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: God as a distant, static deity
verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Presenting Jesus as an active participant on a 'gigantic stage' who 'stands still' to listen.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as the Lead Actor/Director of transformation.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Connects the 'Take heart' of the crowd to the 'Sursum Corda' (Lift up your hearts) of the Eucharist.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the ARCHITECTURAL/THEATRICAL domain, which provides a strong narrative arc. It successfully moves from a historical/cultural source (Grand Central Station) to a theological target (The Kingdom of God as a site of transformation).

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: A bit abstract compared to the 'Stage' metaphor.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Frame the High Priest as the 'Mediator' or 'Lead Intercessor' within the drama.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Jesus steps into the spotlight to speak for those who have no voice.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'Stage' to 'Father/Mother' at the end.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly state that the 'Drama' is a family reunion.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Actors don't have agency; they just follow a script.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that in this drama, the 'script' is written through our 'glad obedience' and choices.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To ground the 'transformation' in organic growth rather than just 'performance'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using a single, powerful conceptual metaphor to unify disparate biblical texts and challenge the congregation's self-perception.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT focuses on how the 'Stage' metaphor functions as a cognitive map for understanding discipleship, rather than just being a 'pretty' illustration.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT shows how the preacher restructures the hearer's neural mapping of 'mercy' through the 'theatrical' lens.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher is using the 'Stage' metaphor to solve the problem of 'apathy' by re-categorizing the hearer as a 'participant' rather than a 'spectator'.

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses 'Deictic Shifts' to pull the audience into the 'Text World' of the Gospel.
